com.yantra.ypm.japi.ue

Interface YPMOverrideGetOrderPriceUE


  • public interface YPMOverrideGetOrderPriceUE
    User exit to override the output of getOrderPrice API.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document overrideGetOrderPrice(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YPMOverrideGetOrderPriceUE user exit is called whenever the getOrderPrice API is invoked.

    • Method Detail

      • overrideGetOrderPrice

        org.w3c.dom.Document overrideGetOrderPrice(YFSEnvironment env,
                                           org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                    throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YPMOverrideGetOrderPriceUE user exit is called whenever the getOrderPrice API is invoked. It is invoked after determining price of the order. The user exit input contains the prices and adjustments generated for the order, if price is configured for the order line item. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit to override all the calculated pricing information. If the user exit is overriding any order line prices or adjustments then it is expected to return all the order lines in the same order as they were passed to the user exit. Overriding any Adjustment element resets that adjustment list, hence all the adjustments should be passed on overriding.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.

        Additional manual adjustments can be added to the order header and order lines from the user exit. Existing manual adjustments can also be removed from the order header and order lines from the user exit. The ManualAdjustmentOperation attribute of the Adjustment element is used to add or remove a manual adjustment. A child AdjustmentAction element is used to return the ChargeCategory, ChargeName and Reference information. If a new manual adjustment is added that has the same ChargeCategory and ChargeName of an existing manual adjustment, the new manual adjustment will get added to the existing manual adjustment.

        For the ChargeName and ChargeCategory to be passed to the UserExit, the UserExit template will need to be updated. The ChargeName and ChargeCategory attributes should be added to the <Adjustment> element under the following three places: OrderLine/LineAdjustments/Adjustment, OrderLine/OrderAdjustments/Adjustment and OrderLine/ShippingAdjustments/Adjustment.

        Below are examples for adding and removing manual adjustments to the order header and order lines.

        Example: Adding new manual adjustment to an order line

        <OrderLines>
            <OrderLine ...>
                ...
                <LineAdjustments>
                    <Adjustment ManualAdjustmentOperation="ADD" IsManualAdjustment="Y" AdjustmentID="Fee" AdjustmentAvaliable="-5" AdjustmentApplied="-5" AdjustmentPerUnit="-1" ChargeCategory="Fees" ChargeName="Fee" ...>
                         <AdjustmentAction ChargeCategory="Fees" ChargeName="Fee1" Reference="Ref1" />
                     </Adjustment>
                 </LineAdjustments>
                ...
            </OrderLine>
        </OrderLines>

        Example: Removing an existing manual adjustment from an order line

        <OrderLines>
            <OrderLine ...>
                ...
                <LineAdjustments>
                    <Adjustment ManualAdjustmentOperation="REMOVE" IsManualAdjustment="Y" AdjustmentID="Fee" AdjustmentAvaliable="-5" AdjustmentApplied="-5" AdjustmentPerUnit="-1" ChargeCategory="Fees" ChargeName="Fee" ...>
                         <AdjustmentAction ChargeCategory="Fees" ChargeName="Fee1" Reference="Ref1" />
                     </Adjustment>
                 </LineAdjustments>
                ...
            </OrderLine>
        </OrderLines>

        Example: Adding a new manual adjustment to the order header

        <Order>
            ...
            <Adjustments>
                <Adjustment ManualAdjustmentOperation="ADD" IsManualAdjustment="Y" AdjustmentID="Fee" AdjustmentAvailable="-5" AdjustmentApplied="-5" ChargeCategory="Fees" ChargeName="Fee">
                    <AdjustmentAction ChargeCategory="Fees" ChargeName="Fee" Reference="ref1"/>
                </Adjustment>
            <Adjustments>
            ...
        </Order>

        Example: Removing an existing manual adjustment from the order header

        <Order>
            ...
            <Adjustments>
                <Adjustment ManualAdjustmentOperation="REMOVE" IsManualAdjustment="Y" AdjustmentID="Fee" AdjustmentAvailable="-5" AdjustmentApplied="-5" ChargeCategory="Fees" ChargeName="Fee">
                    <AdjustmentAction ChargeCategory="Fees" ChargeName="Fee" Reference="ref1"/>
                </Adjustment>
            <Adjustments>
            ...
        </Order>


        Example: Splitting an Order Line

        This User Exit supports splitting of an existing Order Line into multiple child lines, provided that there is no loss in total order quantity before and after split. A few important implementation notes about this feature: 1. The splitting is done only for Draft Orders. 2. The splitting implementation considers the configured SplitLine Document Template for copying the attributes from Parent Order Line to the resultant child line(s). Only the Pricing attributes from the output of user exit are considered when creating the new resultant child Order line.

        Sample output form user exit if an OrderLine with LineID="1" with 5 quantity has to be split into 3 lines with quantities 3,1,1 each.

        <OrderLines>
            <OrderLine LineID="1" Quantity="3" ....
            <OrderLine Quantity="1" SplitFromLineID="1" ....
            <OrderLine Quantity="1" SplitFromLineID="1" ....
        </OrderLines>

        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return document should contain XML data as required by the getOrderPrice API output. If the user exit is overriding any line item then it is expected to return all the line items in the same order as they were passed to the user exit. Overriding any Adjustment element resets that adjustment list, hence all the adjustments should be passed on overriding.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML document containing XML data as required by the getOrderPrice API output. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
